review: The item is:  Leitz A4 Hard Covered Notebook, Squared, 90 gsm Ivory Paper, Solid Range, Black, 80 Sheets  item code 4664I feel compelled to review this item because my reading of some others’ reviews leads me to think that they were reviewing some other item.I needed a hard-backed A4 squared-ruled journal log-book; not too thick, and also robust enough to use daily without it becoming tatty. name: Leitz A4 Hard Covered Notebook, Squared, 90 gsm Ivory Paper, Solid Range, Black, 80 Sheets
review: I picked this up because I get through a lot of A4 notepads in my day job and am always looking for good quality ones.This is a hardback cover notebook with an attractive laminate purple cover with a circular design.  The notepad also comes in white, orange, lime green, pink, blue and ice blue.  There are 80 pages (or 160 sides) and the pages are ruled but note that the ruled lines are framed within each page and do not run from edge to edge.  There's also a header box with space for a title and date, which does make it easier to organise notes but also cuts down on the amount of space you have to write in.The paper quality is good - I use rollerballs generally and there wasn't any leakage through the paper and the ivory white colour means that most ink colours show up on it.My only real criticism is that it's quite expensive for what it is - there are other providers out there doing decent quality pads for a quarter of what this costs.  As such, I can't say that I would rush to buy one on that basis but your needs may be different.

name: My Notes A4 Card Cover Wirebound Notebook, Ruled with Margin and Perforated, 200 Page, 1 Notebook Black
review: About a year ago I bought some Oxford Campus notebooks and found them excellent. I really like how my fountain pen looks on the pages, there's no bleeding unlike with other notebooks (e.g., Pukka Pads). Recently the Oxford Campus line was changed to include "support" for Oxford's Scribzee app, which I didn't want — there are ugly blue markers in the corners of all the pages of the new notebooks.Happily, this notebook is very similar to the old Oxford Campus ones; that is to say, it doesn't support Scribzee and has clean pages for you to do as you like with. One of the photos shows my old Campus notebook (left) next to this one (right). The paper is almost exactly the same between them (the old one looks a little grey as it's been in my bag for several months).Overall, I'm very happy. This is a quality notebook at a good price without any gimmicks like the Scribzee app.
